note.p: Birth: Church Lane, Chelsea, London, England (23 September 1735)
Burial: Chancel of Pertenhall church, Bedfordshire
Education: Emmanuel College, Cambridge (Natural Science) BD (1766)
Career: Ordained deacon (1758); Tutor, Sidney Sussex College, Cambridge (1760-1770); University Professor of Botany (1762, for 63 years)
References: L B Glyn, 'Israel Lyons: a short but starry career. The life of an eighteenth-century Jewish botanist and astronomer' in NR 2002 vol 56 pp 275-305
